benchmark_details.name: FineBadminton: A Multi-Level Dataset for Fine-Grained Badminton Video Understanding
benchmark_details.overview: FineBadminton features a unique multi-level semantic annotation hierarchy for comprehensive badminton understanding. It provides a novel and large-scale dataset aimed at fine-grained analysis of badminton videos, evaluating MLLMs on nuanced spatio-temporal reasoning and tactical comprehension.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and in-depth dataset for analyzing badminton gameplay and to evaluate multimodal large language models (MLLMs) on fine-grained video understanding tasks.

data.source: Publicly accessible professional badminton match videos released by the Badminton World Federation on YouTube.
data.annotation: Multi-level semantic annotations including Foundational Actions, Tactical Semantics, and Decision Evaluation created through a combination of human annotation and MLLM-generated proposals.

methodology.calculation: Performance on tasks is calculated based on accuracy for multiple-choice questions and a scoring system for open-ended responses using GPT-4.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding of the fine-grained actions and strategies within badminton videos.
methodology.baseline_results: Competing MLLMs were tested, showing competitive accuracy improvements with the proposed strategies.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments validating the utility of the dataset, measuring model performance against various benchmarks.
